column4: i'm having issues with firefox regarding flash.  Everytime i run youtube firefox freezes up and I have to force quit.  I just upgraded to the 64 bit 1.04. How do I get flash working??
ubuntu 8.04?
it ran fine with 8.04
sorry, the newest version of Ubuntu
you could try http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplayer10.html
I have tried that, when i unzipped it Ubuntu could not run the program
run it with 'sh flashinstaller....'
ok
i typed the "sudo apt-get install nspluginwrapper flashplugin-nonfree" it worked for one video...i loaded another and firefox froze again
why did you type that command?
i sent you the link for 64bit flash from adobe

ok sorry i'm removing the previous command that I listed, then I have downloaded the flash plugin to the desktop how do I install it once I have unzipped it from the tar.gz file.  Sorry I am still somewhat new to the terminal
sh flashplug....
type that in terminal?
type sh then the name of the file
ok thank you
when I typed that into the terminal this came back "Can't Open libflashplugin"
you need to remove flashplugin-nonfree and ndiswrapper first
I have done that
I did remove the nspluginwrapper and the flashplugin-nonfree before typing the sh libflashplayer.so , this still did not work
oh, I thought you had the installer, close firefox, and copy that file to a folder in ~/.mozilla/plugins/
ok
is there a command i can type into terminal to copy the flash into the mozilla/plugin file? I can not find where mozila/plugin file is
